intro: Calycomelia biltmoreana, commonly known as the Biltmore's calycomelia, is a rare flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its distinctive, showy flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and thrives in partial shade. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, with a smooth texture and a deep green color. Calycomelia biltmoreana is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants.
